intro: Hesperochiron nanus, commonly known as the small purple orchid, is a diminutive flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, erect stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Its most distinctive feature is its small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring. Hesperochiron nanus is a rare and delicate species, often found in specialized microhabitats.
